question.text: Our marketing strategy will be ___ influenced by the feedback we receive from the customer satisfaction survey.
Larper Painting ___ a special sale next month to celebrate its new store on Abagael Avenue.

answer.explanation:
Run st = Manage st
"Next month" means that the action will be in the future so we choose "will be running" as there is no "by" for the answer to be passive voice.

question.text: The plane will be landing ___ Chicago in twenty minutes.

answer.explanation: (C) In is used with city locations. Choices (A) and (D) are not used with locations in this context. Choice (B) may be used only when a from/to contrast is stated or implied (e.g. from the suburbs into the city).

question.text: Members are g vital part of the Global Musicians1 Association, and finding ways to increase membership should be a high ___ .
These reports must be turned___before the end of the week.

answer.explanation: (D) “Turned in” means submitted. Choices (A), (B), and (C) cannot be used in this context.

question.text: Mr. Jones finally___a promotion, and he was very happy to get it.

answer.explanation: (D) “Received” means “got”. Choices (A), (B), and (C) all look similar to the correct answer but have very different meanings.

question.text: The seminar was canceled because the invitations were not___in time.

answer.explanation: (B) “Were not” requires a past participle to complete the verb. Choice (A) is a noun. Choice (C) is in the progressive form. Choice (D) is the simple form.

question.text: Mr. Selvas delivered the___ bid to the client.

answer.explanation: (D) Someone else sealed the bid; use the past participle. Choices (A) and (B) are verbs. Choice (C) is the present participle.

question.text: The Sineville Bridge will be closed ___ the week of June 5.
The hotel's quiet mountain setting provides a ___ change for visitors who live in a crowded city,

answer.explanation: We are giving more information on the noun "change" so we choose an adjective.
